findhr.xai.factual.ranking_shap

Functions

new_model_predict_val(array, ...[, ...])

placeholder_predict(array)

Classes

RankingShap(permutation_sampler, ...[, ...])

This class implements the RankingShap method for feature attribution in ranking problems.
class findhr.xai.factual.ranking_shap.RankingShap(permutation_sampler, background_data, original_model, explanation_size=3, name='', nsample_permutations='auto', rank_similarity_coefficient=<function RankingShap.<lambda>>)

This class implements the RankingShap method for feature attribution in ranking problems. It uses the SHAP library to compute Shapley values for feature importance.

Parameters:

permutation_samplerstr

The type of permutation sampler to use. Options are “kernel” or “sampling”.

background_datanp.ndarray

The background data used for computing Shapley values.

original_modelcallable

The original model used for predictions.

explanation_sizeint, optional

The number of features to include in the explanation. Default is 3.

namestr, optional

The name of the explainer. Default is an empty string.

nsample_permutationsint or str, optional

The number of permutations to sample. Default is “auto”.

rank_similarity_coefficientcallable, optional

The function used to compute the rank similarity coefficient. Default is Kendall’s tau.

get_query_explanation(query_features, query_id='')

Get the explanation for a specific query.

Parameters:

query_featuresnp.ndarray

The feature vector for the query.

query_idstr, optional

The ID of the query. Default is an empty string.

Returns:

dict

A dictionary containing the feature importance scores.
